alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Rutherford; Sumner; Williamson; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 11 at 5:43PM CDT until June 11 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Davidson County in Middle Tennessee... Northwestern Rutherford County in Middle Tennessee... Southeastern Sumner County in Middle Tennessee... Northeastern Williamson County in Middle Tennessee... Central Wilson County in Middle Tennessee... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 543 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Oak Hill, or 7 miles south of Nashville, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Franklin, Gallatin, Lebanon, Nashville, Hendersonville, Brentwood, La Vergne, Mount Juliet, Nolensville, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, Belle Meade, Lakewood, Hermitage, Rural Hill, Bellevue, Antioch, Belinda City, Old Hickory and Berry Hill. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 196 and 248. Interstate 65 between mile markers 68 and 88. Interstate 24 between mile markers 47 and 63. Interstate 840 between mile markers 67 and 76. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
